Vila Ulongwe is an easy drive from the Dedza, Malawi border along a beautiful, paved, all-weather highway in the Angonia district of Tete Province.
The town is small enough to travel by foot, though local transport by bike or vehicle is also readily available.

value: City park with fountain labeled Vila Coutinho
The main road as viewed from the central market, Vila Ulongwe, Mozambique

Vila Ulongwe is the site of the Hefsiba Christian Theological College, an accredited Bible training school founded in 1994 originally by the Reformed Church in Mozambique. According to their website: "Not only do students here receive Bible and theological training but also develop the ability to write and speak English, to better their knowledge of the Portuguese language, to become computer literate, to turn out as community development facilitators and able to lead the battle against HIV/AIDS. In general the leadership style conveyed is that of servant hood, with Christian compassion towards the poor and the needy."
A Barclay's bank is available with ATM.
Basic accommodations are available, like the Pousada Angonia near the local Mercado.
